   19: %%
   20: %%% Purpose : Test records.
   21: 
   22: -module(record_cover_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   27: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   28: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   29: 	 errors/1,record_test_2/1,record_test_3/1,record_access_in_guards/1,
   30: 	 guard_opt/1,eval_once/1,foobar/1,missing_test_heap/1,
   31: 	 nested_access/1,coverage/1,grab_bag/1,slow_compilation/1,
   32:          record_updates/1]).
   33: 
   34: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   35:     Config.
   36: 
   37: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   38:     ok.
   39: 
   40: suite() ->
   41:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   42:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   43: 
   44: all() -> 
   45:     [{group,p}].
   46: 
   47: groups() -> 
   48:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   49:       [errors,record_test_2,record_test_3,
   50:        record_access_in_guards,guard_opt,eval_once,foobar,
   51:        missing_test_heap,nested_access,coverage,grab_bag,
   52:        slow_compilation,record_updates]}].
   53: 
   54: 
   55: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   56:     _ = id(Config),                  %Make return value unpredicatble.
   57:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   61:     ok.
   62: 
   63: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   67:     Config.
   68: 
   69: 
   70: -record(foo, {a,b,c,d}).
   71: -record(bar, {a,b,c,d}).
   72: -record(barf, {a,b,c,d,e}).
   73: 
   74: errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   75:     Foo = #foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4},
   76:     #foo{a=19,b=42,c=3,d=4} = update_foo(Foo, 19, 42),
   77: 
   78:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19)),
   79:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35)),
   80:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35, 17)),
   81:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35, 17, 42)),
   82: 
   83:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19)),
   84:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35)),
   85:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35, 17)),
   86:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35, 17, 42)),
   87:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19,
   88:                                                           35, 17, 42, -2)),
   89: 
   90:     ok.
   91: 
   92: update_foo(#foo{}=R, A, B) ->
   93:     R#foo{a=A,b=B}.
   94: 
   95: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A) ->
   96:     R#bar{a=A}.
   97: 
   98: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B) ->
   99:     R#bar{a=A,b=A}.
  100: 
  101: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C) ->
  102:     R#bar{a=A,b=A,c=C}.
  103: 
  104: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D) ->
  105:     R#bar{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D}.
  106: 
  107: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A) ->
  108:     R#barf{a=A}.
  109: 
  110: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B) ->
  111:     R#barf{a=A,b=A}.
  112: 
  113: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C) ->
  114:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C}.
  115: 
  116: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D) ->
  117:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D}.
  118: 
  119: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D, E) ->
  120:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D,e=E}.
  121: 
  122: 
  123: -define(TrueGuard(Expr), if Expr -> ok; true -> ct:fail(failed) end).
  124: -define(FalseGuard(Expr), if Expr -> ct:fail(failed); true -> ok end).
  125: 				
  126: record_test_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  127:     true = is_record(#foo{}, foo),
  128:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf),
  129:     false = is_record({foo}, foo),
  130: 
  131:     true = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo),
  132:     false = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf),
  133:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, foo),
  134: 
  135:     false = is_record([], foo),
  136:     false = is_record(Config, foo),
  137: 
  138:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  139:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  140:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo)),
  141: 
  142:     ?TrueGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  143:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  144:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record({foo}, foo)),
  145: 
  146:     ?FalseGuard(is_record([], foo)),
  147:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Config, foo)),
  148: 
  149:     %% 'not is_record/2' to test guard optimization.
  150: 
  151:     ?FalseGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  152:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  153:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record({foo}, foo)),
  154: 
  155:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  156:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  157:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record({foo}, foo)),
  158: 
  159:     Foo = id(#foo{}),
  160:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, foo)),
  161:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, barf)),
  162: 
  163:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(Config, foo)),
  164: 
  165:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(a, foo)),
  166:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record([], foo)),
  167: 
  168:     %% Pass non-literal first argument.
  169: 
  170:     true = is_record(id(#foo{}), foo),
  171:     false = is_record(id(#foo{}), barf),
  172:     false = is_record(id({foo}), foo),
  173: 
  174:     true = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), foo),
  175:     false = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), barf),
  176:     false = erlang:is_record(id({foo}), foo),
  177: 
  178:     NoRec1 = id(blurf),
  179:     NoRec2 = id([]),
  180: 
  181:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec1, foo)),
  182:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec2, foo)),
  183: 
  184:     %% The optimizer attempts to move expressions to guards,
  185:     %% but it must not move an is_record/2 call that is not
  186:     %% allowed in a guard in the first place.
  187: 
  188:     ok = case is_record(id({a}), id(a)) of
  189: 		   true -> ok;
  190: 		   false -> error
  191: 	       end,
  192: 
  193:     %% Force the use of guard bifs by using the 'xor' operation.
  194: 
  195:     False = id(false),
  196:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo) xor False),
  197:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf) xor False),
  198:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo) xor False ),
  199: 
  200:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(Foo, foo) xor False),
  201:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Foo, barf) xor False),
  202: 
  203: 
  204:     %% Implicit guards by using a list comprehension.
  205: 
  206:     List = id([1,#foo{a=2},3,#bar{d=4},5,#foo{a=6},7]),
  207: 
  208:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, foo)],
  209:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, bar)],
  210:     [1,#foo{a=2},3,5,#foo{a=6},7] =
  211: 	[X || X <- List, not is_record(X, bar)],
  212:     [1,3,5,7] =
  213: 	[X || X <- List, ((not is_record(X, bar)) and (not is_record(X, foo)))],
  214:     [#foo{a=2},#bar{d=4},#foo{a=6}] =
  215: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar)) or (is_record(X, foo)))],
  216:     [1,3,#bar{d=4}] =
  217: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar)) or (X < 5))],
  218: 
  219:     MyList = [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}],
  220:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo)],
  221:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo)],
  222:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin is_record(X, foo) end],
  223:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin not is_record(X, foo) end],
  224:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or
  225: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  226:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  227: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  228:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X)],
  229:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  230: 			     is_reference(X)],
  231:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  232: 				   begin is_record(X, foo) or
  233: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  234:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  235: 				   begin not is_record(X, foo) or
  236: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  237:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  238: 			begin is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X) end],
  239:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  240: 			 begin not is_record(X, foo) or
  241: 				   is_reference(X) end],
  242: 
  243:     Map = id(#{a => 1, b => #foo{a=2}, c => 3, d => #bar{d=4},
  244:                e => 5, f => #foo{a=6}, h => 7}),
  245:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = lists:sort([X || _ := X <- Map, is_record(X, foo)]),
  246:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || _ := X <- Map, is_record(X, bar)],
  247:     [1,3,5,7,#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] =
  248: 	lists:sort([X || _ := X <- Map, not is_record(X, bar)]),
  249:     [2,6] = lists:sort([A || _ := #foo{a=A} <- Map]),
  250: 
  251:     %% Call is_record/2 with illegal arguments.
  252:     [] = [X || X <- [], is_record(t, id(X))],
  253:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch [X || X <- [1], is_record(t, id(X))]),
  254: 
  255:     %% Update several fields with a string literal.
  256:     #barf{} = Barf0 = id(#barf{}),
  257:     Barf = update_barf(Barf0),
  258:     #barf{a="abc",b=1} = id(Barf),
  259: 
  260:     %% Test optimization of is_record/3.
  261:     false = case id({a,b}) of
  262: 		{_,_}=Tuple -> is_record(Tuple, foo)
  263: 	    end,
  264:     false = case id(true) of
  265: 		true=Bool -> is_record(Bool, foo)
  266: 	    end,
  267: 
  268:     ok.
  269: 
  270: record_test_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  271:     true = is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5),
  272:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5),
  273:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6),
  274:     false = is_record({foo}, foo, 5),
  275:     false = is_record({foo}, foo, -1),
  276:     false = is_record(id({foo}), foo, -1),
  277: 
  278:     true = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5),
  279:     true = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, id(foo), 5),
  280:     false = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5),
  281:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, 5),
  282:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, -1),
  283:     false = erlang:is_record(id({foo}), foo, -1),
  284:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, id(foo), -1),
  285: 
  286:     false = is_record([], foo),
  287:     false = is_record(Config, foo),
  288: 
  289:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  290:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5)),
  291:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6)),
  292:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  293: 
  294:     ?TrueGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  295:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5)),
  296:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6)),
  297:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  298: 
  299:     ?FalseGuard(is_record([], foo, 5)),
  300:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Config, foo, 5)),
  301: 
  302:     %% 'not is_record/2' to test guard optimization.
  303: 
  304:     ?FalseGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  305:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6)),
  306:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  307: 
  308:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  309:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5)),
  310:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  311: 
  312:     Foo = id(#foo{}),
  313:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, foo, 5)),
  314:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, barf, 6)),
  315: 
  316:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(Config, foo, 5)),
  317: 
  318:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(a, foo, 5)),
  319:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record([], foo, 5)),
  320: 
  321:     %% Pass non-literal first argument.
  322: 
  323:     true = is_record(id(#foo{}), foo, 5),
  324:     false = is_record(id(#foo{}), barf, 6),
  325:     false = is_record(id({foo}), foo, 5),
  326: 
  327:     true = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), foo, 5),
  328:     false = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), barf, 6),
  329:     false = erlang:is_record(id({foo}), foo, 5),
  330: 
  331:     NoRec1 = id(blurf),
  332:     NoRec2 = id([]),
  333: 
  334:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec1, foo, 5)),
  335:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec2, foo, 5)),
  336: 
  337:     %% Force the use of guard bifs by using the 'xor' operation.
  338: 
  339:     False = id(false),
  340:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5) xor False),
  341:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6) xor False),
  342:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo, 5) xor False ),
  343: 
  344:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(Foo, foo, 5) xor False),
  345:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Foo, barf, 6) xor False),
  346: 
  347: 
  348:     %% Implicit guards by using a list comprehension.
  349: 
  350:     List = id([1,#foo{a=2},3,#bar{d=4},5,#foo{a=6},7]),
  351: 
  352:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, foo, 5)],
  353:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, bar, 5)],
  354:     [1,#foo{a=2},3,5,#foo{a=6},7] =
  355: 	[X || X <- List, not is_record(X, bar, 5)],
  356:     [1,3,5,7] =
  357: 	[X || X <- List, ((not is_record(X, bar, 5)) and (not is_record(X, foo, 5)))],
  358:     [#foo{a=2},#bar{d=4},#foo{a=6}] =
  359: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar, 5)) or (is_record(X, foo, 5)))],
  360:     [1,3,#bar{d=4}] =
  361: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar, 5)) or (X < 5))],
  362: 
  363:     MyList = [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}],
  364:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo, 5)],
  365:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo, 5)],
  366:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin is_record(X, foo, 5) end],
  367:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin not is_record(X, foo, 5) end],
  368:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  369: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  370:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  371: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  372:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X)],
  373:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  374: 			     is_reference(X)],
  375:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  376: 				   begin is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  377: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  378:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  379: 				   begin not is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  380: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  381:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  382: 			begin is_record(X, foo, 5) or is_reference(X) end],
  383:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  384: 			 begin not is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  385: 				   is_reference(X) end],
  386: 
  387:     %% Update several fields with a string literal.
  388:     #barf{} = Barf0 = id(#barf{}),
  389:     Barf = update_barf(Barf0),
  390:     #barf{a="abc",b=1} = id(Barf),
  391: 
  392:     %% Non-literal arguments.
  393:     true = is_record(id(#barf{}), id(barf), id(6)),
  394:     false = is_record(id(#barf{}), id(barf), id(42)),
  395:     false = is_record(id(#barf{}), id(foo), id(6)),
  396: 
  397:     Rec = id(#barf{}),
  398:     Good = id(barf),
  399:     Bad = id(foo),
  400:     Size = id(6),
  401: 
  402:     true = is_record(Rec, Good, Size) orelse error,
  403:     error = is_record(Rec, Bad, Size) orelse error,
  404: 
  405:     %% GH-7298: Zero size.
  406:     TupleA = id({a}),
  407: 
  408:     false = is_record(TupleA, a, 0),
  409:     false = is_record(Bad, a, 0),
  410: 
  411:     ZeroF = fun(A) when is_record(A, a, 0) -> ok;
  412:                (_) -> error
  413:             end,
  414:     error = ZeroF(TupleA),
  415:     error = ZeroF(Bad),
  416: 
  417:     %% GH-7317: Huge tuple size used to take forever to compile.
  418:     false = is_record(TupleA, a, 10_000_000),
  419:     false = is_record(Bad, a, 10_000_000),
  420: 
  421:     HugeF = fun(A) when is_record(A, a, 10_000_000) -> ok;
  422:                (_) -> error
  423:             end,
  424:     error = HugeF(TupleA),
  425:     error = HugeF(Bad),
  426: 
  427:     ok.
  428: 
  429: record_access_in_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  430:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  431:     file:set_cwd(test_lib:get_data_dir(Config)),
  432:     Opts0 = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors|test_lib:opt_opts(?MODULE)],
  433:     M = record_access_in_guards,
  434:  
  435:     Opts = [strict_record_tests|Opts0],
  436:     io:format("Options: ~p\n", [Opts]),
  437:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, Opts),
  438:     ok = M:t(),
  439:     ok.
  440: 
  441: 
  442: %% Test optimization of record access and is_record/2 in guards.
  443: 
  444: -record(r, {a = 4,b}).
  445: -record(r1, {a,b}).
  446: -record(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}).
  447: -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  448: 
  449: guard_opt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  450:     ok = fun() ->
  451: 		 F = fun(F, [H,H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  452: 			     [H|F(F, T)];
  453: 			(F, [H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  454: 			     [H|F(F, T)];
  455: 			(_, []) -> []
  456: 		     end,
  457: 		 [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}] =
  458: 		     F(F, [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}]),
  459: 		 {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(F, [#r1{}])),
  460: 		 ok
  461: 	 end(),
  462: 
  463:     true = fun() ->
  464: 		   R = #r{},
  465: 		   if is_record(R, r) -> true; true -> false end
  466: 	   end(),
  467: 
  468:     ok = fun() ->
  469: 		 F = fun(true, B) when B#r1.a -> ok;
  470: 			(false, _) -> error
  471: 		     end,
  472: 		 ok = F(true, #r1{a=true}),
  473: 		 error = F(false, anything_goes),
  474: 		 {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r1{})),
  475: 		 {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r{})),
  476: 		 ok
  477: 	 end(),
  478: 
  479:     ok = fun() ->
  480: 		 F = fun([{a,R}=T]) when R#r.a =:= 42 ->
  481: 			     {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  482: 			([{a,R}=T]) when R#r1.a =:= 7 ->
  483: 			     {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  484: 			(_) -> error
  485: 		     end,
  486: 		 {ok,2} = F([{a,#r{a=42}}]),
  487: 		 {ok,2} = F([{a,#r1{a=7}}]),
  488: 		 error = F([{a,#r1{}}]),
  489: 		 error = F({a,b,c}),
  490: 		 error = F([]),
  491: 		 ok
  492: 	 end(),
  493: 
  494:     ok = fun() ->
  495: 		 F = fun(X, Y, Z) when is_record(X, r1) andalso
  496: 				       (is_record(Y, r2) orelse
  497: 					is_record(Z, r3)) -> true;
  498: 			(_, _, _) -> false
  499: 		     end,
  500: 		 true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  501: 		 true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, blurf),
  502: 		 true = F(#r1{}, blurf, #r3{}),
  503: 		 false = F(#r1{}, blurf, blurf),
  504: 		 false = F(blurf, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  505: 		 false = F(blurf, #r2{}, blurf),
  506: 		 false = F(blurf, blurf, #r3{}),
  507: 		 false = F(blurf, blurf, blurf),
  508: 		 ok
  509: 	 end(),
  510: 
  511:     ok = fun() ->
  512: 		 F = fun(R=#r{a=42}) when R#r.b =:= 7 ->
  513: 			     {ok,R};
  514: 			(_) -> error
  515: 		     end,
  516: 		 {ok,#r{a=42,b=7}} = F(#r{a=42,b=7}),
  517: 		 error = F(#r{}),
  518: 		 error = F([a,b,c]),
  519: 		 ok
  520: 	 end(),
  521: 
  522:     ok.
  523: 
  524: update_barf(R) ->
  525:     R#barf{a="abc",b=1}.
  526: 
  527: eval_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  528:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  529: 		       true = erlang:is_record(GetRec(), foo)
  530: 	       end, #foo{}),
  531:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  532: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1}
  533: 	       end, #foo{}),
  534:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  535: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2}
  536: 	       end, #foo{}),
  537:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  538: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3}
  539: 	       end, #foo{}),
  540:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  541: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4}
  542: 	       end, #foo{}),
  543:     ok.
  544: 
  545: once(Test, Record) ->
  546:     put(?MODULE, 0),
  547:     GetRec = fun() ->
  548: 		     put(?MODULE, 1+get(?MODULE)),
  549: 		     Record
  550: 	     end,
  551:     Result = Test(GetRec),
  552:     case get(?MODULE) of
  553: 	1 -> ok;
  554: 	N ->
  555: 	    io:format("Evaluated ~w times\n", [N]),
  556: 	    ct:fail(more_than_once)
  557:     end,
  558:     Result.
  559: 
  560: %% Thanks to Martin Bjorklund.
  561: 
  562: -record(foobar, {status}).
  563: 
  564: foobar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  565:     {ok,_,_} = x({foo, 1}),
  566:     ok.
  567: 				       
  568: get_bar() ->
  569:     #foobar{status = 1}.
  570: 
  571: x(Trans) ->
  572:     {foo, Barno} = Trans,
  573:     case get_bar() of
  574: 	Bar when Bar#foobar.status == 1 ->
  575: 	    noop(Bar),
  576: 	    Bar33 = Bar#foobar{status = 1},
  577: 	    {ok, Bar33, Barno};
  578: 	_ ->
  579: 	    Trans
  580:     end.
  581: 
  582: noop(_) ->
  583:     ok.
  584: 
  585: -record(foo_rec,
  586: 	{foo_1,
  587: 	 foo_2 = 0,
  588: 	 foo_3 = 0}).
  589: 
  590: missing_test_heap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  591:     #foo_rec{foo_2=2,foo_3=5} = missing_test_heap_1(#foo_rec{foo_2=1,foo_3=4}),
  592:     ok.
  593: 
  594: 
  595: %% Two test_heap instructions would be incorrectly merged (not allowed
  596: %% because of gc_bif instructions for addition).
  597: missing_test_heap_1(A = #foo_rec {foo_1 = _B,
  598: 				  foo_3 = C,
  599: 				  foo_2 = D}) ->
  600:     A#foo_rec {foo_1 = {C, D},
  601:   	       foo_3 = C + 1,
  602:   	       foo_2 = D + 1}.
  603: 
  604: -record(nrec0, {name = <<"nested0">>}).
  605: -record(nrec1, {name = <<"nested1">>, nrec0=#nrec0{}}).
  606: -record(nrec2, {name = <<"nested2">>, nrec1=#nrec1{}}).
  607: 
  608: nested_access(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  609:     N0 = #nrec0{},
  610:     N1 = #nrec1{},
  611:     N2 = #nrec2{},
  612:     <<"nested0">> = N0#nrec0.name,
  613:     <<"nested1">> = N1#nrec1.name,
  614:     <<"nested2">> = N2#nrec2.name,
  615:     <<"nested0">> = N1#nrec1.nrec0#nrec0.name,
  616:     <<"nested0">> = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1.nrec0#nrec0.name,
  617:     <<"nested1">> = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1.name,
  618:     <<"nested0">> = ((N2#nrec2.nrec1)#nrec1.nrec0)#nrec0.name,
  619: 
  620:     N1a = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1{name = <<"nested1a">>},
  621:     <<"nested1a">> = N1a#nrec1.name,
  622: 
  623:     N2a = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1.nrec0#nrec0{name = <<"nested0a">>},
  624:     N2b = ((N2#nrec2.nrec1)#nrec1.nrec0)#nrec0{name = <<"nested0a">>},
  625:     <<"nested0a">> = N2a#nrec0.name,
  626:     N2a = N2b,
  627:     ok.
  628: 
  629: -record(rr, {a,b,c}).
  630: -record(fileheader, {read_md5,md5,eof,trailer}).
  631: 
  632: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  633:     %% There should only remain one record test in the code below.
  634:     R0 = id(#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3}),
  635:     B = R0#rr.b,				%Test the record here.
  636:     R = R0#rr{c=42},				%No need to test here.
  637:     if 
  638: 	B > R#rr.a ->				%No need to test here.
  639: 	    ok
  640:     end,
  641:     #rr{a=1,b=2,c=42} = id(R),			%Test for correctness.
  642: 
  643:     %% Cover beam_ssa_opt:ssa_opt_element/1 and friends.
  644:     error1 = check_file_header(#fileheader{read_md5=1,md5=2}),
  645:     error2 = check_file_header(#fileheader{trailer=true,eof=false}),
  646:     error3 = check_file_header(#fileheader{}),
  647: 
  648:     %% Cover sanitization of is_tagged_tuple in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  649:     {'EXIT',_} = catch id((catch 22)#rr.a),
  650: 
  651:     %% Cover beam_ssa_bool.
  652:     error = coverage_1(true),
  653: 
  654:     ok.
  655: 
  656: check_file_header(FH) ->
  657:     if
  658:         FH#fileheader.read_md5 =/= FH#fileheader.md5 ->
  659:             error1;
  660:         FH#fileheader.trailer =/= FH#fileheader.eof ->
  661:             error2;
  662:         true ->
  663:             error3
  664:     end.
  665: 
  666: coverage_1(V) when false#rr.b; V, "abc" ->
  667:     ok;
  668: coverage_1(_) ->
  669:     error.
  670: 
  671: -record(default_fun, {a = fun(X) -> X*X end}).
  672: 
  673: %% compiler treats records with 1 and 2 fields differently...
  674: -record(gb_nil, {}).
  675: -record(gb_foo, {hello=1}).
  676: -record(gb_bar, {hello=2,there=3}).
  677: -record(gb_rh, {mod,mid}).
  678: 
  679: %% Taken from compilation_SUITE and other places.
  680: grab_bag(_Config) ->
  681:     T1 = fun() ->
  682: 		 X = #foo{},
  683: 		 Y = #foo{},
  684: 		 {X#foo.a == Y#foo.a,X#foo.b}
  685: 	 end,
  686:     {true,undefined} = T1(),
  687: 
  688:     T2 = fun(X, Y) ->
  689: 		 first_arg(X#foo.a =/= Y#foo.a, X#foo.b =/= X#foo.b)
  690: 	 end,
  691:     true = T2(#foo{a=x,b=z}, #foo{a=y,b=z}),
  692: 
  693:     T3 = fun() ->
  694: 		 #default_fun{a=Fun} = id(#default_fun{}),
  695: 		 9 = Fun(3)
  696: 	 end,
  697:     T3(),
  698: 
  699:     %% Stupid code, but the compiler used to crash.
  700:     T4 = fun() ->
  701: 		 F0 = fun() ->
  702: 			      R1 = #gb_nil{},
  703: 			      R2 = R1#gb_nil{},
  704: 			      R1 = R2
  705: 		      end,
  706: 		 F1 = fun() ->
  707: 			      R1 = #gb_foo{},
  708: 			      R2 = R1#gb_foo{},
  709: 			      R1 = R2
  710: 		      end,
  711: 
  712: 		 F2 = fun() ->
  713: 			      R1 = #gb_bar{},
  714: 			      R2 = R1#gb_bar{},
  715: 			      R1 = R2
  716: 		      end,
  717: 		 F0(),
  718: 		 F1(),
  719: 		 F2()
  720: 	 end,
  721:     T4(),
  722: 
  723:     %% Used to crash beam_ssa_bool during its development.
  724:     T5 = fun(RH) ->
  725:                  if
  726:                      is_record(RH, gb_rh) andalso
  727:                      is_atom(RH#gb_rh.mod) andalso
  728:                      RH#gb_rh.mid /= 42 -> ok;
  729:                      true -> error
  730:                  end
  731:          end,
  732:     ok = T5(#gb_rh{}),
  733:     ok = T5(#gb_rh{mod=atom,mid=0}),
  734:     error = T5(#gb_rh{mod=100,mid=0}),
  735:     error = T5(#gb_rh{mod=atom,mid=42}),
  736:     error = T5(#gb_nil{}),
  737:     error = T5(#gb_bar{}),
  738:     error = T5(atom),
  739: 
  740:     %% With type optimizations disabled, beam_ssa_pre_codegen would insert
  741:     %% set_tuple_element instructions between the call to setelement/3 and
  742:     %% its succeeded instruction.
  743:     T6 = fun(R) ->
  744:                  try
  745:                      %% The succeeded instruction should immediately follow its instruction.
  746:                      %% Not like this:
  747:                      %%
  748:                      %%   x0/_212 = call (`erlang`:`setelement`/3), `5`, y0/_87:37, `4`
  749:                      %%   z0/@ssa_dummy:34 = set_tuple_element `3`, x0/_212, `3`
  750:                      %%   z0/@ssa_dummy:35 = set_tuple_element `2`, x0/_212, `2`
  751:                      %%   z0/@ssa_dummy:36 = set_tuple_element `1`, x0/_212, `1`
  752:                      %%   z0/@ssa_bool:13 = succeeded x0/_212
  753:                      %%   br z0/@ssa_bool:13, ^14, ^4
  754:                      R#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4}
  755:                  of
  756:                      42 ->
  757:                          ok
  758:                  catch
  759:                      _:_ ->
  760:                          error
  761:                  end
  762:          end,
  763:     error = catch T6(100),
  764:     error = catch T6([a,b,c]),
  765:     error = catch T6(#bar{}),
  766:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,#foo{}},_}} = catch T6(#foo{}),
  767: 
  768:     ok.
  769: 
  770: %% ERIERL-436; the following code used to be very slow to compile.
  771: %%
  772: %% #slow_r{} should have about 4x as many fields for the test to be effective
  773: %% (all of them matched in slow_compilation/1), but unfortunately the memory
  774: %% use scales together with the speed so we'll run out of memory on many of
  775: %% our test machines before we reach noticeable levels (2+ minutes before the
  776: %% fix).
  777: %%
  778: %% We've therefore scaled it down to the current level, at least it it'll guard
  779: %% against excessive regressions.
  780: 
  781: -record(slow_r,
  782:         {f0,  f1, f2, f3, f4, f5, f6, f7, f8, f9,
  783:          f10,f11,f12,f13,f14,f15,f16,f17,f18,f19,
  784:          f20,f21,f22,f23,f24,f25,f26,f27,f28,f29,
  785:          f30,f31,f32,f33,f34,f35,f36,f37,f38,f39,
  786:          f40,f41,f42,f43,f44,f45,f46,f47,f48,f49,
  787:          f50,f51,f52,f53,f54,f55,f56,f57,f58,f59}).
  788: 
  789: slow_compilation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  790:     R = id(#slow_r{}),
  791: 
  792:     [{f0,R#slow_r.f0},{f1,R#slow_r.f0},{f1,R#slow_r.f1},
  793:      {f2,R#slow_r.f2},{f3,R#slow_r.f3},{f4,R#slow_r.f4},
  794:      {f5,R#slow_r.f5},{f6,R#slow_r.f6},{f7,R#slow_r.f7},
  795:      {f8,R#slow_r.f8},{f9,R#slow_r.f9},{f10,R#slow_r.f10},
  796:      {f11,R#slow_r.f11},{f12,R#slow_r.f12},{f13,R#slow_r.f13},
  797:      {f14,R#slow_r.f14},{f15,R#slow_r.f15},{f16,R#slow_r.f16},
  798:      {f17,R#slow_r.f17},{f18,R#slow_r.f18},{f19,R#slow_r.f19},
  799:      {f20,R#slow_r.f20},{f21,R#slow_r.f21},{f22,R#slow_r.f22},
  800:      {f23,R#slow_r.f23},{f24,R#slow_r.f24},{f25,R#slow_r.f25},
  801:      {f26,R#slow_r.f26},{f27,R#slow_r.f27},{f28,R#slow_r.f28},
  802:      {f29,R#slow_r.f29},{f30,R#slow_r.f30},{f31,R#slow_r.f31},
  803:      {f32,R#slow_r.f32},{f33,R#slow_r.f33},{f34,R#slow_r.f34},
  804:      {f35,R#slow_r.f35},{f36,R#slow_r.f36},{f37,R#slow_r.f37},
  805:      {f38,R#slow_r.f38},{f39,R#slow_r.f39},{f40,R#slow_r.f40},
  806:      {f41,R#slow_r.f41},{f42,R#slow_r.f42},{f43,R#slow_r.f43},
  807:      {f44,R#slow_r.f44},{f45,R#slow_r.f45},{f46,R#slow_r.f46},
  808:      {f47,R#slow_r.f47},{f48,R#slow_r.f48},{f49,R#slow_r.f49},
  809:      {f40,R#slow_r.f50},{f51,R#slow_r.f51},{f52,R#slow_r.f52},
  810:      {f53,R#slow_r.f53},{f54,R#slow_r.f54},{f55,R#slow_r.f55},
  811:      {f56,R#slow_r.f56},{f57,R#slow_r.f57},{f58,R#slow_r.f58},
  812:      {f59,R#slow_r.f59}].
  813: 
  814: record_updates(_Config) ->
  815:     F1 = fun(N) ->
  816:                  R0 = #foo{},
  817:                  R1 = R0#foo{a=N},
  818:                  R2 = R1#foo{b=2},
  819:                  R2#foo{c=3}
  820:          end,
  821: 
  822:     Foo0 = F1(id(42)),
  823:     #foo{a=42,b=2,c=3,d=undefined} = Foo0,
  824:     Foo1 = #foo{a=42,b=99,c=3,d=undefined} = Foo0#foo{b=id(99)},
  825: 
  826:     _ = id(0),
  827: 
  828:     #foo{a=42,b=99,c=3,d=999} = Foo1#foo{d=999},
  829: 
  830:     F2 = fun(N) when is_integer(N) ->
  831:                  R0 = #bar{a=N},
  832:                  R1 = R0#bar{b=N+1},
  833:                  R2 = R1#bar{c=N+2},
  834:                  R2#bar{d=N+3}
  835:          end,
  836:     #bar{a=100,b=101,c=102,d=103} = F2(id(100)),
  837: 
  838:     F3 = fun(R0, N) when is_integer(N) ->
  839:                  R1 = R0#foo{a=N},
  840:                  R2 = R1#foo{b=N},
  841:                  R3 = R2#foo{a=atom},
  842:                  R3#foo{c=3}
  843:          end,
  844:     #foo{a=atom,b=7,c=3,d=undefined} = F3(id(#foo{}), 7),
  845: 
  846:     ok.
  847: 
  848: %%%
  849: %%% Common utilities.
  850: %%%
  851: 
  852: first_arg(First, _) -> First.
  853: 
  854: id(I) -> I.
